message: I dont always know someone's username, but its fun to guess and get close. With avatars I'd get even closer.
@maddox that's actually a really good suggestion!

Anyone else get face fatigue? One of the things I like about IRC vs convore is I get a break from seeing so many faces on my computer. I like to see peoples' faces but seeing avatars hundreds of times a day lessens the experience for me. :/ Also Malcolm Gladwell's blink.
@bat maybe an option to disable avatars?
here's a big one of me to emphasize the point
I love faces too...it's different when someone personally shows me their face (as in IRL or when posting a picture).
...but being deluged with them in meaningless contexts day after day...annoying.
going to solve it with a Chrome Extension though https://github.com/benatkin/TMI
My question is: what would you replace them with? A meaningless placeholder would seem more annoying to me. Having usernames there would be redundant and mess up the alignment.
a solid, rounded box slightly darker than the background color, I think

@bat A blank placeholder would bother me more, personally. I  think @mrjbq7 might have a good idea about just leaving them out entirely and starting the text at the far left. It might at least be a good option to have for users.
Or even better, a way to replace them with another image... Pidgin has that option.  Some people on my buddy list are just smiley faces :)
